    • Field Detail

      • lastMove

        public byte lastMove

    • Constructor Detail

      • Puzzle

        public Puzzle()
        Description of constructor. This is defaul size of the puzzle. In future size of the puzzle can different, but in this work we will stayt in 4*4 puzzle.

      • Puzzle

        public Puzzle(int rows,
      int columns)
        Description of constructor. Although default size 4*4 is used in this work other size puzzles have been made possible in this constructor, which gives values final variables. Constructor puts values for all the cells in using initializePuzzle-method . Numbers are 0 - 15. Number 15 means empty cell or place, which traditionaly is in down-right corner at solution state of the puzzle.
        Parameters:
        rows - number of rows in puzzle
        columns - number of columns in puzzle

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfColumns

        public int getNumberOfColumns()
        Description of getNumberOfColumns(). This method returns number of the collumns in the puzzle. At default it will be 4, but other size is also possible.
        Returns:
        number of columns in puzzle

      • getNumberOfRows

        public int getNumberOfRows()
        Description of getNumberOfRows(). This mehtod return number of the rows in the puzzle. Ath default it will be 4, but other size is also possible.
        Returns:
        number of rows in puzzle

      • getPuzzle

        public byte[][] getPuzzle()
        Description of getPuzzle(). This mehtod returns byte[][]-array, which contains current state of the puzzle.
        Returns:
        gives puzzle in byte[][] form

      • getEmpty

        public byte getEmpty()
        Description of getEmpty(). This method return numerical value for empty. At default 4*4 puzzle it is 15, but it can be something else too depending size of the puzzle.
        Returns:
        gives number which present empty place in puzzle

      • getEmptyCol

        public int getEmptyCol()
        Description of getEmptyCol(). This method return column where empty place is situated.
        Returns:
        gives vertical position of empty place in puzzle

      • getEmptyRow

        public int getEmptyRow()
        Description of getEmptyRow(). This method return row where empty place is situated.
        Returns:
        gives horizontal position of empty place in puzzle

      • getLastMove

        public byte getLastMove()
        Description of getLastMove(). This method return most recent move. Lets say that number 5 was moved done to empty place under it. So then lastMove-variable have value 5.
        Returns:
        gives number which has been most recently moved

      • getNumberInCell

        public byte getNumberInCell(int row,
                   int col)
        Description of getNumberInCell(). This method return number in certain cell.
        Parameters:
        row - horizontal position of the cell
        col - verticl position of the cell
        Returns:
        gives number which is positioned to asked row and column

      • getCordinates

        public int[] getCordinates(int num)
        Description of getCordinates(). This method return array with two values. Firt number tells in which row number is and second number tells column.
        Parameters:
        num - number which position in puzzle is searched.
        Returns:
        gives array which contains row and column cordinate of search number

      • setPuzzle

        public void setPuzzle(byte[] newSequence)
        Description of setPuzzle(byte[] newSequence). This method puts puzzle to state given by byte[]-array. Mainly this method is used in testing purposes, where we want to run searcing algorithms with specific permutation of the puzzle. Attention! because newSequence contains presentation of puzzle in form where numbers run from 1 to 16. When this numbers are added to puzzle[][]-array one is subtracted. Same with check of the empty.
        Parameters:
        newSequence - puzzle permutation in byte[] form

      • setPuzzle

        public void setPuzzle(byte[][] newSequence)
        Description of setPuzzle(byte[][] newSequence). This method puts puzzle to state given by byte[][]-array. Method is used in A*-algorithm
        Parameters:
        newSequence - puzzle permutation in byte[][] form

      • setCell

        public void setCell(int row,
           int col,
           byte value)
        Description of setCell(int row, int col). This method changes value in particular cell. For normally there is no need for this. Use of it creates just a mesh. This is only for certain calculation in LinearConflict Class, because I did not find any more sensible way to do it. So please don't use this method.
        Parameters:
        row - row in the puzzle
        col - column in the puzzle

      • setLastMove

        public void setLastMove(byte lastMove)
        Description of setLastMove(byte lastMove). This method set new value for lastMove-variable. Normally there is no need to it, because setting this value is automatically done when movement is done. But A*-algorithm needs it. You don't!
        Parameters:
        lastMove - number which has most recent move.

      • up

        public boolean up()
        Description of up(). This method 'slides' empty place up. And moves number above it down.
        Returns:
        true if movement was done otherwise false

      • down

        public boolean down()
        Description of down(). This method 'slides' empty place donwn. And number under it up.
        Returns:
        true if movement was done otherwise false

      • left

        public boolean left()
        Description of left(). This method 'slides' empty place left. And number left from it to right.
        Returns:
        true if movement was done otherwise false

      • right

        public boolean right()
        Description of right(). This method 'slides' empty place right. And number right from it to left.
        Returns:
        true if movement was done otherwise false

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Description of shuffle(). This method does random moves to shuffle the puzzle. It will be do either 1000 or 1001 moves. This because with only even or odd amount of the moves you can't get all the permutations of the shuffle.

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle(int numberOfMoves)
        Description of shuffle(int numberOfMoves). This method does given amount of random moves to shuffle the puzzle.
        Parameters:
        numberOfMoves -

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Description of isReady(). This method checks if puzzle is solved. Puzzle is solved when nubers run 0 to 15 from up-right corner row by row to down-left corner.
        Returns:
        true if puzzle is solved otherwise false

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description of toString(). This method returns string presentation of the state of the puzzle. Because in fifteen puzzle numbers are from 1 to 15 and empty. And puzzle uses 0 to 14 and empty (15). One is added every number in string presentation and empty gets ".." sign.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string presentation of the puzzle

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Description of hashCode(). This method return hash of byte[][]-array. It is needed in MyHashSet Class which is needed in A*-algorithm.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        hash of byte[][] arrays

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Description of equals(Object obj). This method compares two puzzles and finds out if numbers in this puzzles are in same order.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - compared puzzle
        Returns:
        hash of byte[][] arrays
